text: 6.12 [1] (a) Explain what may happen during the course of the Gram-Schmidt process if the matrix A is rank deficient. (b) Show that classical Gram-Schmidt and the modified version are mathematically equivalent (i.e., when carried out in infinite precision). (c) Construct a 3 x 2 example, using a decimal floating point system with a 2-digit fraction, in which modified Gram-Schmidt proves to be more numerically stable than the classical version.
